title: Who makes the best speakers? - Quora

response.answer_text: With time, effort, practice, and competent feedback, nearly anyone can become a good speaker. Who makes the best speakers? IMHO, the best speakers are those who… 1. Have something to say of value to their audience 2. Are more deeply committed to meeting the needs of their audience than their own needs 3. Have written, revised, rewritten, revised their presentation to ensure the likelihood that their message is heard and to maximize the impact of each word 4. Have rehearsed, revised, rehearsed, received competent feedback/criticism of content, style, as well as delivery, revised some more… and then have memorized the presentation to the point that it is smoothly delivered with well timed pauses, relevant vocal variety, etc., etc. 5. Delivers in such a manner as to clearly communicate their passion, authenticity, and sincerity for the topic to the audience. 6. Interacts and responds with the audience to maximize their engagement, listening, and internalization. 7. The best speakers deliver their presentations repeatedly demonstrating a high level of energy each time, as if each speech being delivered, were being done for the very first time.

Their are two key factors that make an excellent public speaker or an orator. I call it “Who and How?” First is your confidence, presentation, voice, body language (overall persona). Second is the topic, or discussion worth sharing with people. I have seen (in most cases), that the speaker has some kind of self accomplishment or a life story (of their or others) to share, and to inspire. If you can give something important or entertaining to the crowd, then you can even skip the first factor. The thing is that people should listen to you.
